Title: Object: Old Castille
Description: A couple riding a donkey from left to right, with a gun hanging at the saddle, a little girl walking by the animal's head, looking up at it, a man behind them to left, drinking from a gourd, a woman wearing a hat with a veil, one hand on her hip, to right, near an elderly couple, the man wearing a heavy cloak and broad-brimmed hat, with a view of isolated city buildings on the horizon. Lithograph printed in grey ink
Curator's comments: Very similar in style and format to 'Sir David Wilkie's Sketches in Turkey, Syria & Egypt, 1840 & 1841', a set of lithographs of oriental subjects by Nash after Wilkie which were published in two volumes, London, 1843 and 1846 (1918,0205.2-8). Wilkie visited the continent, including Spain, in 1825-1827.
